intro: Santiria parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered santiria, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant features small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are typically opposite, ovate, and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Santiria parviflora is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
